responses.rationale: The verbs used ('disclosed', 'lived', 'had developed', 'can accompany') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verbs used ('had contact', 'developed symptoms', 'said') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verbs used ('turned up negative', 'may have been tested', 'pick up signs') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verb 'added' is not a high-potency verb or potent metaphor.
The verbs used ('developed symptoms', 'instituted precautions', 'were not tested') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verbs used ('analyzing results', 'would reveal', 'were exposed') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verbs used ('has been identified', 'has the hospital...been identified', 'was treated') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verbs used ('is led', 'assistance from') are not high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
The verb 'criticized' describes an opinion/reaction, not the direct impact of the threat. It is not a high-potency verb describing the event/impact.
The phrase 'can get a lot of information out of' is not a high-potency verb or potent metaphor.
